choices.text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
in javascript how do you save to and read back from localstorage

### Response:

To save data in LocalStorage, we can use the `localStorage.setItem()` method which takes two arguments - a key (string) for the name of the item being saved and a value (any type) to be stored as its value. To retrieve the saved items from local storage, you can use the `localStorage.getItem(key)` method where "key" is the name of the item that was previously set using the `setItem()` method.
